stem: The nurse is caring for a client with an external ventricular drain (EVD) for intracranial pressure (ICP) monitoring. Which nursing actions are essential for the safe management of this device?

options.text: Maintaining a continuous high-pressure flush through the ventricular catheter.
Assessing the insertion site for clear or bloody drainage.
Clamping the EVD during all patient repositioning or transfers.
Using strict aseptic technique when handling all components of the system.
Leveled the transducer at the level of the tragus (external auditory meatus).
Keeping the drip chamber at the prescribed height relative to the patient's head.

rationale.correct: EVD management is highly critical. (A) Leveling at the tragus is the standard for ventricular monitoring. (B) Clamping during movement prevents accidental overdrainage or surge in CSF. (D) Asepsis is mandatory to prevent ventriculitis/meningitis. (E) Monitoring the site for CSF leaks is a safety priority. (F) The height of the chamber determines the pressure at which CSF drains.
rationale.incorrect: (C) Ventricular catheters should *never* have a continuous high-pressure flush (like an arterial line). Flushing can cause rapid brain injury or herniation by increasing intracranial volume/pressure.

answerBreakdown.label: A
answerBreakdown.content: In this specific NGN scenario, "Maintaining a continuous high-pressure flush through the ventricular catheter." is incorrect as it introduces clinical risk or deviates from standard triage logic.

answerBreakdown.label: B
answerBreakdown.content: Identifying "Assessing the insertion site for clear or bloody drainage." is a priority nursing action/finding essential for maintaining patient safety in this scenario.

answerBreakdown.label: C
answerBreakdown.content: The inclusion of "Clamping the EVD during all patient repositioning or transfers." is necessary to address the underlying physiological instability identified during assessment.

answerBreakdown.label: D
answerBreakdown.content: "Using strict aseptic technique when handling all components of the system." represents a critical metric that must be monitored to evaluate the effectiveness of the current medical plan.

answerBreakdown.label: E
answerBreakdown.content: "Leveled the transducer at the level of the tragus (external auditory meatus)." represents a critical metric that must be monitored to evaluate the effectiveness of the current medical plan.

answerBreakdown.label: F
answerBreakdown.content: Clinically, "Keeping the drip chamber at the prescribed height relative to the patient's head." is the most appropriate finding pointing toward the suspected condition and requiring intervention.

clinicalPearls: Normal ICP is 5-15 mmHg. Sustained ICP >20 mmHg requires immediate medical intervention.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Do NOT flush an ICP line like an arterial line. The systems look similar but the logic is opposite. Flushing the brain kills cells.

mnemonic.title: L-A-V-A
mnemonic.expansion: Level at tragus, Aseptic technique, Vent the pressure, Avoid flushing.

reviewUnits.heading: Intracranial Pressure (ICP) Monitoring
reviewUnits.body: The EVD allows for both pressure monitoring and therapeutic drainage of CSF. Inaccurate leveling or positioning of the drain can lead to catastrophic neurological injury.
